field.name: Criteria for Stopping Breastfeeding for HIV Exposed Children | Counseling
Acceptable: mother perceives no problem in replacement feeding
Feasible: mother has adequate time, knowledge, skills, resources, and support to correctly mix formula or milk and feed infant up to 12 times in 24 hours
Affordable: mother and family can pay the cost of replacement feeding without harming the health and nutrition of the family
Sustainable: availability of a continuous supply of all ingredients needed for safe replacement feeding up to one year of age or longer
Safe: Replacement foods are correctly and hygienically prepared and stored
